node.title: Judge Is Urged to Resign Over Racial Slur in Video Recorded at Her Home
node.alt: Michelle Odinet, then a candidate for judge of Lafayette City Court, in July 2020.
node.description: Michelle Odinet, a judge in Louisiana, said she had “zero recollection” of the episode captured on video, in which off-screen voices are heard narrating security-camera footage of a failed burglary attempt.
node.content: ["A Louisiana judge is facing calls to resign after a video recorded at her home captured several people using a racial slur while watching home security footage of a foiled burglary outside the judge\u2019s house.", "The judge, Michelle Odinet of the City Court of Lafayette, La., said she was on a sedative at the time the video was made and had no memory of the episode.", "After an unknown source released the video to the local news media, several civic groups including the Lafayette branch of the N.A.A.C.P. called on the judge to resign, and criminal defense lawyers asked the judge to recuse herself from their cases.", "Judge Odinet confirmed to The Current, a nonprofit news organization in Lafayette that reported on the video on Monday, that the footage was recorded in her home.", "\u201cI have zero recollection of the video and the disturbing language used during it,\u201d Judge Odinet told The Current in a statement. \u201cAnyone who knows me and my husband, knows this is contrary to the way we live our lives.\u201d", "In the minute-long video, unseen people inside the judge\u2019s home can be heard using a racist slur repeatedly and laughing as they narrate security-camera footage \u2014 playing on a television \u2014 of a person trying to break into a car in a driveway.", "The word \u201cmom\u201d is used a few times in the clip and at least two people in the room identify themselves as being in the security footage, helping to stop the burglary.", "Judge Odinet said in the statement that her \u201cmental state was fragile\u201d because of the attempted burglary, and that she \u201cwas given a sedative at the time of the video.\u201d Although Judge Odinet described the burglary as \u201carmed,\u201d the police report makes no mention of a weapon, according to The Current.", "\u201cI am deeply sorry and ask for your forgiveness and understanding as my family and I deal with the emotional aftermath of this armed burglary,\u201d the judge said.", "The Lafayette Police Department said that an attempted burglary took place at 2 a.m. on Saturday and that an unnamed victim held the suspect down until officers arrived. The suspect, a 59-year-old Black man, was arrested and charged with two counts of simple burglary, the police said.", "Judge Odinet, a Republican, was elected in November 2020 to be the judge for Division A of Lafayette City Court. City judges serve a six-year term.", "She was previously a prosecutor for the district attorney\u2019s offices in New Orleans and Lafayette.", "The Lafayette chapter of the N.A.A.C.P. called for the judge\u2019s resignation in a statement from its president, Michael Toussaint. \u201cWe do not believe a person having her revealed disposition should fulfill any office bearing the powers over judiciary,\u201d Mr. Toussaint said.", "The Louisiana Legislative Black Caucus, the Louisiana Democratic Party and the Southern division of the Anti-Defamation League also called for her resignation.", "Others called for accountability, but stopped short of requesting the judge\u2019s resignation, including Reggie Thomas, the Lafayette city marshal and the first Black man elected to a citywide office in Lafayette, and State Senator Gerald Boudreaux, a Democrat.", "The senator said he would officially petition for the Judiciary Commission of Louisiana to investigate the incident.", "\u201cThis situation and the comments are reprehensible, offensive and totally unacceptable from anyone serving as a judge,\u201d Mr. Boudreaux said in a statement. \u201cThe comments fail to identify any form of lamentation and cast a cloud relative to the impartiality of the judge to serve as an unbiased arbitrator in cases involving African Americans.\u201d"]
